thread.title: Jack O' Lantern Days, Crex Howl-O-Ween, Haunted Submarine
thread.title_full: Jack O' Lantern Days, Crex Howl-O-Ween, Haunted Submarine

title: Jack O' Lantern Days, Crex Howl-O-Ween, Haunted Submarine
text:
Jack O' Lantern Days, Crex Howl-O-Ween, Haunted Submarine By Chelsey Lewis of the Journal Sentinel Oct. 25, 2015 6:00 a.m. (0) Comments 
Belleville: UFO Day . In 1987, police officers and citizens in Belleville reported seeing an unidentified flying object over the town. The small Dane County burg celebrates that sighting with a silly festival Saturday. The day begins with a pancake breakfast from 7:30 to 11:30 a.m. at Schwoegler's Sugar River Lanes, continues with a Color Run/Walk at 10 a.m., a parade on Main St. at 1 p.m., a Monster Costume Ball at 8:30 p.m., and live music and a craft show throughout the day. See belleville-wi.com . 
Eagle River: Hallow Fest. Celebrate Halloween in downtown Eagle River Saturday with a hay maze, treasure hunt, pet parade, kids costume contest, Zombie 5K Fun Run and a Monster Bash, featuring entertainment and hors d'oeuvres. The fun run is $35 and starts at 4:45 p.m.; the bash is $20 and kicks off at 7 p.m. See eagleriver.org . 
Fish Creek: Jack O' Lantern Days. Join in this family friendly celebration in and around Fish Creek Friday through next Sunday. Activities include mask making, a costume contest, pumpkin carving, trick-or-treating, Door County Trolley Ghost Tours and a great pumpkin lighting. See visitfishcreek.com . 
Grantsburg: Crex Howl-O-Ween. The sandhill cranes migrating through this wildlife area aren't the only draw to Crex Meadows, 102 East Crex Ave., this weekend. Visit between 5 and 9 p.m. Saturday for this Halloween celebration, complete with guided hikes on a trail lighted by jack-o'-lanterns, wildlife bingo, crafts and treats. See crexmeadows.org . 
Manitowoc: Haunted Submarine. Brave the dark, narrow corridors of a World War II submarine this Halloween. The Wisconsin Maritime Museum, 75 Maritime Drive, is offering special haunted tours of the USS Cobia from 7 to 11 p.m. Friday and Saturday. The tours are $5 and may not be suitable for children under the age of 10. See wisconsinmaritime.org . 
St. Croix Falls: Howlin' Halloween. Bring the whole family for a costume contest, games, pumpkin carving, scary stories, songs and treats at 6 p.m. Friday at the St. Croix Festival Theatre, 210 N. Washington St. A spooky comedy is set for 7:30 p.m. At-will donations will be accepted. See festivaltheatre.org . 
Illinois: Halloween at Navy Pier. Head to Chicago's Navy Pier Saturday for a costume contest, trick-or-treating, live entertainment, scary movies and more during this annual Halloween celebration. Stay late for a special round of fireworks at 9:30 p.m. See navypier.com . 
Minnesota: Twin Cities Film Fest. Choose from more than 120 short and feature films at this festival, which continues through Saturday at the Showplace ICON Theatre in St. Louis Park. The festival also includes live music, cocktail mixers, panel discussions and other special events. Individual tickets are $12 for non-gala films and $20 for gala films. See twincitiesfilmfest.org . 
Please send notice of events three weeks in advance to: All Over the Map, Travel Section, P.O. Box 371, Milwaukee, WI 53201 or to jsfeat@journalsentinel.com, with All Over the Map as the subject. Â© 2015 , Journal Sentinel Inc. All rights reserved. About Chelsey Lewis 
Chelsey Lewis writes about travel and things to do in Wisconsin for Wisconsin Trails and the Journal Sentinel.
